      • mergeVectFiles

        public static java.io.File mergeVectFiles(java.util.List<java.io.File> file2MergeIn,
                                          java.io.File fileOut,
                                          boolean keepAttributes)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:

      • mergeVectFiles

        public static java.io.File mergeVectFiles(java.util.List<java.io.File> file2MergeIn,
                                          java.io.File fileOut,
                                          java.io.File boundFile,
                                          boolean keepAttributes)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Merge a list of shapeFiles. The method employed is depending on the schemas of the shapefiles and if the attributes need to be kept.
        • If shemas are the same, the simplefeatures are added to a defaultfeature collection
        • If shemas aren't the same but have the same number of attributes, simple features are (a warning is sent)
        • If shemas aren't the same with different number of attributes, only the geometry of the file are kept.
        Possible to define an geometric bound on which only the intersecting data are kept.
        Parameters:
        file2MergeIn - List of shapefiles to merge
        fileOut - Output shapefile
        boundFile - Bound shapefile
        keepAttributes - Do we need to keep the attributes or not
        Returns:
        The merged ShapeFile
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public static java.io.File gridDiscretizeShp(java.io.File inFile,
                                             java.io.File outFile,
                                             int gridResolution)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Algorithm to spit a shapefile with a squared grid.
        Parameters:
        inFile - Input shapeFile
        outFile - Output shapeFile
        gridResolution - Size of a side of the squared mesh
        Returns:
        a shapefile with the cuted features
